title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Uva, Southern and Eastern provinces and in Polonnaruwa district after 1.00 p.m.

title: Black smoke signals no pope elected in first conclave vote
byline: Black smoke billowed from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel on Wednesday evening, signalling an inconclusive first vote by cardinals locked in the Sistine Chapel in a conclave to elect a new pope to guide the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Three suspects arrested in connection with Meetiyagoda double murder
byline: Three suspects have been arrested for aiding and abetting the shooting and murder of two individuals in front of a restaurant in Thambahitiya, Meetiyagoda.

title: Electricity tariff revisions expected soon, PUCSL says CEB to submit proposals
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) says it expects the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to submit proposals related to the second electricity tariff revision of the year within the coming week.

title: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets drop by 3% in April 2025
byline: The official reserve assets of Sri Lanka have dropped by 3% at the end of April, to USD 6.32 billion, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka said.

title: 12 injured in accident near Palatuwa exit of Southern Expressway
byline: A total of 12 persons sustained injuries when a van traveling along the Matara–Akuressa main road collided with a container truck that was parked by the roadside near the Palatuwa exit of the Southern Expressway this morning (08).

title: Samantha Ranasinghe takes oath as MP
byline: Samantha Ranasinghe was sworn in as a Member of Parliament before the Speaker of House, a short while ago.

title: Disney to open theme park in the Middle East
byline: Walt Disney has announced plans to open its first theme park in the Middle East.

title: Proposed road through Wilpattu National Park will not go ahead, court told
byline: The Attorney General has informed the Supreme Court yesterday (07) that authorities have decided not to proceed with the construction of a road through the Wilpattu National Park, as previously suggested.

title: EC to request parties to name new chairpersons to LG bodies
byline: The National Election Commission says it will notify all political parties and independent groups that have secured a majority in local government bodies to name chairpersons for those institutions.

title: FR filed seeking to annul recently signed MoU between Sri Lanka and India
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition has been filed before the Supreme Court on Wednesday (07), seeking an order to invalidate the Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) recently signed between the governments of Sri Lanka and India.

title: Blast heard in Pakistan’s Lahore amid tensions with India
byline: A blast was heard in Pakistan’s eastern city of Lahore on Thursday morning, according to broadcaster Geo TV and a Reuters witness, a day after Indian strikes at multiple locations in the country and fears of an escalation in conflict between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: All flights from Colombo to Lahore, Pakistan suspended - SriLankan Airlines
byline: All flights from Sri Lanka to Lahore, Pakistan have been suspended till further notice due to safety concerns, SriLankan Airlines has announced.

title: Traffic movement affected along Duplication Road due to protest
byline: Vehicular movement along the R. A. De Mel Mawatha (Duplication Road) has been severely affected owing to a protest, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Govt. keen to maintain electricity tariffs unchanged, Energy Minister claims
byline: The government hopes to maintain electricity tariffs unchanged in the current situation, Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody stated in Parliament.

title: 2,000-2,500 children in Sri Lanka suffering from Thalassemia: Health Officials
byline: Between 2,000 and 2,500 children in Sri Lanka are suffering from Thalassemia, a genetic blood disorder that impairs the body’s ability to produce healthy red blood cells, according to the Ministry of Health.

title: Sri Lanka’s first quarter budget deficit at Rs. 498 bn
byline: Sri Lanka’s government has recorded a significant budget deficit of Rs. 498.28 billion in the first quarter of 2025, according to the Financial Performance Statement submitted to the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: New Commissioner General of Examinations appointed
byline: Subhashini Indika Kumari Liyanage, who is currently serving as an Examinations Commissioner in the Department of Examinations, has been appointed as the Commissioner General of Examinations with immediate effect.

title: SC dismisses appeal by Patali Champika
byline: The Supreme Court has dismissed the petition filed by former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka, who sought an order to quash the indictment filed by the Attorney General against three defendants, including him.

title: 15 Sri Lankans rescued from Myanmar cybercrime centers and repatriated
byline: A total of 15 Sri Lankans who were trafficked and forcibly employed in cybercrime centers in Myawaddy, Myanmar have been rescued and repatriated, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Cabinet greenlights minimum wage hike for private sector employees
byline: The government has taken another step towards ensuring the national minimum monthly and daily wages of private sector employees be increased in parallel with the recent revision in the salaries of state sector employees.

title: “No one will be allowed to use Sri Lanka’s airspace or land to attack another country”
byline: The government will not allow any faction to use Sri Lanka’s airspace or the country’s territory to attack another nation, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated when questioned on the stance of the government pertaining to India, Pakistan tensions.

title: Appeals Court issues writ order canceling appointment of RDA Director General
byline: The Court of Appeal has issued a writ order canceling the decision made to appoint S.M.P. Suriya Bandara as the Director General of the Road Development Authority (RDA) in 2024.

title: Black smoke rises again: No pope chosen after second round of voting
byline: For the second time since the papal conclave began, black smoke rose from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel, signaling that no candidate has yet secured the votes needed to become the next pope.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued for severe lightning in several provinces.

title: Edu. Ministry issues statement on controversy over death of Grade 10 student
byline: An explanation has been called from the school principal over the death of a Grade 10 student following an alleged sexual assault by a teacher, the Ministry of Education has stated.

title: Pakistani says Indian drone attacked soldiers, while air defences shot down 25 drones
byline: India fired attack drones into Pakistan on Thursday (May 8), with one wounding four soldiers, the Pakistani military said, a day after missiles struck several locations and killed more than two dozen people.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna removed from Parliament Chamber
byline: Member of Parliament (Dr.) Ramanathan Archchuna has been removed from the Parliamentary Chamber for disrupting parliament proceedings.

title: Stop the lies and use power to serve the people - Dilith tells govt.
byline: The government should focus on using its powers to serve the people instead of propagating lies continuously, the leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, MP Dilith Jayaweera said in Parliament.

title: Deshabandhu Tennakoon summoned before inquiry committee
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandhu Tennakoon has been informed to appear before the ‘Committee of Inquiry appointed to inquire and report its findings on Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power’, on May 19, 2025.

title: Deadline extended for senior citizens to apply for income tax refunds
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has announced an extension of the deadline for senior citizens to submit applications for quarterly income tax refunds for the assessment year 2023/2024.

title: Kottawa shooting victim succumbs to injuries
byline: UPDATE: The 43-year-old person injured in the shooting incident at Malapalla, Kottawa has succumbed to his injuries, the Police confirmed.

title: No formal complaint filed yet over alleged sexual assault on schoolgirl: Minister
byline: Minister of Women and Child Affairs Saroja Savithri Paulraj says that she has requested the parents of the Grade 10 student—who reportedly died by suicide following an alleged sexual assault by a teacher—to file a formal complaint with the National Child Protection Authority (NCPA), and that the complaint has not been filed as of yet.

title: New pope elected as white smoke emanates from Sistine Chapel
byline: White smoke billowed from the chimney atop the Vatican’s Sistine Chapel on Thursday, signalling that the 133 cardinals inside have elected a new pope.

title: Cardinal Robert Prevost of US elected Pope Leo XIV
byline: Cardinal Robert Prevost, a missionary who spent his career ministering in Peru and leads the Vatican’s powerful office of bishops, was elected the first American pope in the 2,000-year history of the Catholic Church.
